data.name: Guessing Game
data.description:
Given an integer n (n>=0 and n<=100) return the minimum number of guesses that it would take to find that number in a guessing game using an optimal solution. This is an example of the optimal guessing game solution in case you didn't know:

The answer is 42:
Is the number 50? (min: 0, max: 100) Answer: lower Is the number 25? (min: 0, max: 50) Answer: higher Is the number 37? (min: 25, max: 50) Answer: higher Is the number 43? (min: 37, max: 50) Answer: lower Is the number 40? (min: 37, max: 43) Answer: higher Is the number 41? (min: 40, max: 43) Answer: higher Is the number 42? (min: 41, max: 43) Answer: Yes! The total # of guesses in this case is 7, so that is what you will return. Note to round down. Good luck!
